newsitem.title: USA: Lucent, USA Digital in digital radio pact.
newsitem.headline: Lucent, USA Digital in digital radio pact.

text.p: USA Digital Radio and Lucent Technologies Inc said Monday they had agreed to jointly develop digital audio broadcasting technologies for FM and AM transmission and reception.
The technologies will enable radio stations to offer higher-quality audio and integrated data services, they said.

The joint development pact involves patented digital audio compression and broadcast technologies from Bell Labs, the research and development arm of Lucent, in exchange for digital audio broadcasting technology and broadcasting expertise from USA Digital.
USA Digital is a partnership of Westinghouse Electric Corp and its subsidiary CBS, and Gannett Co Inc.
USA Digital currently is working with receiver and transmitter manufacturers and broadcasters to create a cost-effective, compatible digital audio broadcasting system, the companies said.

"Bell Labs helped pioneer commercial radio broadcasting with station WEAF in the 1920s; we look forward to charting new digital audio broadcasting territories with USA Digital Radio," said Nikil Jayant, director of the Multimedia Communication Research Laboratory at Bell Labs.
The companies did not disclose financial details of the joint development pact.
